comments.body: Yes, I think the meat/fish of mobs in and on water shouldn't be cooked. Maybe it could also be that with just Fire Aspect 1, it's not cooked, while Fire Aspect 2 is strong enough to cook it - maybe that should only work on water/in water of less than 1 block high (meaning flowing water/non-source), because deep under water is still a little too much water. I don't know if these random ideas of mine are the best option though.
You mean cats?
Just use commands to give them the ability to break leaves
Just use paintings and signs or piston doors.
Perhaps rather than growing in a straight line these vines could actively seek blocks in front of them.
Don't see a need to limit their size if placing blocks has no limit, and blocks would be easier. I see this vine as a more decorative block than utility.
Bows too

Hello, this appears to be a non-English post. Below you will find a transcription of the topic being discussed.

Title: “Chestnuts, chestnut trees”

Text: “In various biomes, e.g. Tajda, there is a lot of chestnut trees from which chestnuts fall every 5 minutes. Chestnuts can be burned to a brown dye. Chestnut trees do NOT occur in biomes: Mushroom Jungle Bamboo Forest Neither in the ocean Chestnut trees have the same wood as spruce but a different arrangement of leaves”

- Translated by Admin
What would make delisted stone so special?
o computador mudou algumas palavras: explicaria(ao invés de explicado) e era para falar que eles usam bestas

Translated from Portuguese:

                      Basalt iron ore

                      in the Nether, there could be iron ore, in basalt, that would explain why piglins exchange iron for gold and why they use beasts

 

Thank you for your input there is a current discussion for this topic please feel free to contribute https://feedback.minecraft.net/hc/en-us/community/posts/360060671291-Basalt-Based-Nether-Iron-Ore-
Minecraft is like a pixel
If it's easier to make, and gives a speed boost too, then players won't be inclined to make actual healing potions.

@PlutonicPoet34 the Bottle o' Healing isn't really easier to make nor better to use. The Bottle o' Healing only heals 3 points of health compared to the 4 points of health of a tier one healing potion, requires 4 different items to make for a total of 9 items and only gives a 3 second speed boost. I added a nausea debuff to offset the speed boost. The Bottle o' Healing is only intended for the beginning of the game where the player doesn't have access to potion making equipment.
maybe if less op.. redstone, and iron are 2 common for that
Smooth is for the smelted stones. Polished is for every stone crafted in the crafting table or stonecutter

400423459952 Yeah, but still, Smooth Stone wouldn't be smooth because of the outline on it, I think that Stone shouldn't really have a "Smooth" variant since itself is already smooth enough. The texture of Smooth Stone is pretty good in some cases, but it's not smoother than it's regular counterpart. Even if it requires making an exception to Smooth/Polished methods, or a changed recipe, I think Smooth Stone should not be considered a "Smooth" Block.
I agree, but remove the border and make it a seamless with more towards a solid color than that of regular stone.
I added polished stone and smooth variants as 2 separate blocks. I think polished should be made with a 2*2 of smooth.
Сделайте её чтобы она призывала Визер шторм
Wut
Yes! They should grow on acacia trees or on stalks on the ground in savanna biomes, since in real life, they grow in Madagascar.

Many cooking recipes could benefit from this; pies, cream/curd/glaze, cookies, or an accentuating flavor to an entrée dish like Asian Inspired Salmon or Master Sauce Chicken. A simple combo for Minecraft could be Vanilla Bean + Milk = Vanilla Cream. Placing it in a cold area (surrounded by ice) for a period of time could like an inverse campfire freeze your cream into ice cream; still in the same bucket from the milk & cream. 

Fun question: Have you ever had Vanilla extract alone? It makes your lips go numb & is fairly intense.

 

"I'm not sure I could trust a man who would bypass an Oreo in favor of Vanilla Wafers. It's a fundamental character flaw, possibly a sign of true evil." -Jonathan Maberry
Maybe if you combine it with milk, ice, and a bowl, you can get icecream!

Actually, yes they do grow in Madagascar, but that isn't natural. They are actually native to Central America and the northern half of South America. So I say it should grow in deserts and badlands(VERY rare), as well as Jungles (Common)
Striders are much cheaper and better in my opinion.
I agree this is a great idea!
If there is a Lava Boat, it should be made from Warped/Crimson Wood, which should be fireproof

I think there should be Warped and Crimson Boats, but I think there should be some reason why you would use them over Striders, and vice versa. One idea is that the boats will still burn over time, but they can also be used on water. Striders may also interact with these boats in some way, such as them seeing Crimson Boats as similar to themselves (possibly as competition), and maybe seeing Warped Boats as food. Nether Boats may not be able to be used like normal boats. They may have to be attached to Striders so they can pull other mobs and chests

I was just about to post the same thing!

Inventory should be 9 Slots like a dispenser or dropper. Allowable items should be books, Enchanted Books, Book & Quill, Written Books, paper, maps, locator maps, and treasure/explorer maps.

You can put enchanted books in it and book n quills and maybe paper. Also you should be able to craft bookshelves with no books(empty bookshelves) or bookcases that aren’t interactive but are just regular bookshelf blocks.

The books you place in the bookshelves around your enchanting table affect your enchanting results. If you have a single Unbreaking I enchanted book in a single bookshelf next to your enchanting table, it increases your chances of getting the Unbreaking enchantment on your next item by a percentage, increasing with each similar enchanted book in the surrounding bookshelves. Plain books in every bookshelf, vanilla results from enchanting. Unbreaking enchanted book in every bookshelf (max of 20), 20% increased chance of Unbreaking enchant on next item, OR 20% increased chance of next level Unbreaking enchant on next item.
At the very least, bookshelves as storage for books and enchanted books would be fantastic!  Thumbs up
It could even have a book texture drawn on the inventory slots, like the lapis texture in the enchanting table!
I like this idea.  My dad is an explorer at heart so he would like this idea as well.
I like the idea of netherite trident, but your usage ideas are not good
I think you can already use riptide in lava, as long as you don't die
Maybe, but I think they shouldn't be tridents. For example, for the nether, you could have a hammer. It doesn't make sense to have an aquatic weapon in the nether.

I think the size should matter. Imagine that you build a gigantic mansion. When you were going to break the platform that is holding the mansion, you would be able to carry a mansion in your inventory! And that's is overpowered.
That sound more like it should be a mod
I would rather see a covered wagon or a tent, but Minecraft has yet to introduce the wheel.
You can do this with redstone flying machines.
Nise
You can already do this without mods or new features
Just watch some mumbo jumbo

Black stone is supposed to be like the nether’s stone.

Imagine trying to open a door made entirely of stone in real life.
Maybe we could also have cobblestone or stone doors, too!

How would we open a door made of rock.

I can see solid stone doors, requiring a lever or button, but cobblestone would just look weird and make little sense.
I agree with your proposal, but not with the crafting
Pretty good idea but I think placing only books (enchanted, etc.) in the bookshelf would be more logical!
Hope you guys like the idea! I was going to go onto armer but I ran out of space.
It's a bit of a unique idea, but it is op as all get out.
Its a really cool Idea but mabye the shield could also give thorns if someone attacks it.

Given how rare those books are, that seems like hands-down the most unnecessarily difficult thing to do, but I'll upvote anyway since blackstone might as well be able to do that. Although the idea of a black grindstone also has a kind of appeal.
I agree literally just so I can disenchant soul speed books without needing to go to the overworld. Also allow us to craft stonecutters with blackstone, because it wouldn't hurt at all.

I was thinking a black grindstone would look really cool too, but i understand that might be a lot of effort for such a small feature. But man that could be really cool in builds. This is mostly for convenience though. I just came up with the idea after watching a video on nether only runs.
